alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake and Bear River Valley; Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 11:41PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cache and northern Rich Counties through 1230 AM MDT... At 1140 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Garden, or 13 miles west of Laketown, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Laketown, Lewiston, Garden City, Garden, Bear Lake, North Logan, Richmond, Meadowville, Pickelville, Beaver Mountain and Lakota. This storm will be capable of producing strong gusty winds on Bear Lake. This will lead to a sudden increase in waves and very choppy waters which will result in hazardous boating conditions. Boaters are urged to seek safe harbor if possible. This includes the following highways... US Route 89 between mile markers 464 and 502. Utah Route 30 between mile markers 110 and 133. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bear Lake and Bear River Valley; Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North
